content:
TextView Class

Definition

Provides a programmable control for displaying larger amounts of text, with optional markup tags on a mobile page. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.DefaultProperty("Text")]
[System.ComponentModel.Designer(typeof(System.Web.UI.Design.MobileControls.TextViewDesigner))]
[System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItem("System.Web.UI.Design.WebControlToolboxItem, System.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")]
[System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")]
[System.Web.UI.DataBindingHandler("System.Web.UI.Design.TextDataBindingHandler, System.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")]
[System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DesignerAdapter("System.Web.UI.Design.MobileControls.Adapters.DesignerTextViewAdapter")]
[System.Web.UI.ToolboxData("<{0}:TextView runat="server">TextView</{0}:TextView>")]
public class TextView : System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PagedControl

Remarks

Unlike literal text in a mobile form, you can set content of a TextView from code. Unlike a mobile Label control, you can include markup within the value of the Text property. Also, the TextView control is careful not to break up inserted elements such as links during pagination. For more information, see Literal Text Inside Form Markup.

If the TextView control is within a Panel, set the Paginate property to true to allow text to flow across multiple pages on mobile devices. If the TextView control is not in a Panel, put the name of the TextView control into the ControlToPaginate property.

Most other properties and methods of the mobile TextView control are of more use to developers of new device adapters for rendering the contents on specific devices.

Caution

This control can be used to display user input, which might include malicious client script. Check any information that is sent from a client for executable script, SQL statements, or other code before displaying it in your application. You can use validation controls to verify user input before displaying the input text in a control. ASP.NET provides an input request validation feature to block script and HTML in user input. For more information, see Securing Standard Controls, How to: Protect Against Script Exploits in a Web Application by Applying HTML Encoding to Strings, and Validating User Input in ASP.NET Web Pages.

Constructors

TextView()

Initializes a new instance of the TextView class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public TextView ();

Properties

FirstVisibleElementIndex

Gets the index of the first TextViewElement object on the current text view after the text is paginated. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public int FirstVisibleElementIndex { get; }
Value
Int32

The index of the first TextViewElement object on the current text view when the text view is paginated. If there are no TextViewElement objects for the current TextView object, returns -1.

Remarks

The FirstVisibleElementIndex property is used by developers of custom device adapters for rendering the contents.

FirstVisibleElementOffset

Gets the character offset into the first TextViewElement class, which is displayed when paginated. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public int FirstVisibleElementOffset { get; }
Value
Int32

The character offset into the first TextViewElement class, which is displayed when paginated. If there are no TextViewElement objects for the current TextView object, this value is 0.

Remarks

The FirstVisibleElementOffset property is used by developers of custom device adapters for rendering the contents.

InternalItemCount

Gets the number of items in the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override int InternalItemCount { get; }
Value
Int32

The number of items in the control.

ItemCount

Gets or sets the number of items in the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public int ItemCount { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The number of items in the control.

ItemsPerPage

Sets or returns the number of items displayed per page after pagination. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public int ItemsPerPage { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The number of items displayed per page after pagination.

Remarks

The ItemsPerPage property is used by developers of custom device adapters for rendering the contents.

If zero, pagination is not affected by this property. If nonzero, overrides items displayed per page when the form is paginated. The default value is zero.

Mobile controls that support internal pagination also provide a feature called custom pagination. Normally, such controls require you to provide them all the data that they can display. Developers specify the total number of items that are in the list in the ItemCount property. The ItemsPerPage property specifies how many items the control displays per page.

ItemWeight

Gets the approximate weight of a single item in the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override int ItemWeight { get; }
Value
Int32

The approximate weight of a single item in the control.

LastVisibleElementIndex

Returns the index of the last TextViewElement object on the current TextView object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public int LastVisibleElementIndex { get; }
Value
Int32

The index of the last TextViewElement on the current TextView. If there are no TextViewElement objects on the current TextView, returns 0.

Remarks

The LastVisibleElementIndex property is used by developers of custom device adapters for rendering the contents.

LastVisibleElementOffset

Returns the character offset into the last TextViewElement object, which is displayed when paginated. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public int LastVisibleElementOffset { get; }
Value
Int32

The character offset into the last TextViewElement object, which is displayed when paginated. If there are no TextViewElement objects on the current TextView, returns 0.

Remarks

The LastVisibleElementOffset property is used by developers of custom device adapters for rendering the contents.

Text

Sets or returns the text for the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public string Text { get; set; }
Value
String

The text for the control.

Remarks

For information about the tags (such as <b>) that TextView supports in its Text property, see the TextView class discussion.

The Text property can be specified by using the Text attribute, or as inner text. If the Text property is specified in both ways, the inner text always takes precedence. However, if the Text property is programmatically set, the inner text is automatically removed and the new setting takes precedence.

Methods

GetElement(Int32)

Returns the TextViewElement class at the given index. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextViewElement GetElement (int index);
index
Int32

The index of the TextViewElement class.

Returns
TextViewElement

The TextViewElement at the given index.

Remarks

The GetElement method is used by developers of custom device adapters for rendering the contents.

OnRender(HtmlTextWriter)

Raises the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.Render* event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override void OnRender (System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter writer);
writer
HtmlTextWriter

An HtmlTextWriter that will render the content.

PaginateRecursive(ControlPager)

Paginates the control and its children. Called internally by ASP.NET. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override void PaginateRecursive (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ControlPager pager);
pager
ControlPager

The pager.

Events

LoadItems

Occurs when a control is custom-paginated and needs more data. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public event System.Web.UI.MobileControls.LoadItemsEventHandler LoadItems;

Remarks

When control is custom-paginated, you do not explicitly bind the control. After pagination, the control raises this event, indicating what part of the data is required. The application can handle this event and bind the control with the required data.
